meanings.sent1: After the storm, they had to redispose the fallen branches in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She decided to redispose the furniture in the living room for a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The kids redisposing their toys in a messy pile made their mom laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist redisposed the colors on his palette to create a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef redisposed the ingredients on the cutting board before starting to cook.

meanings.definition: To make susceptible to a certain condition or influence again
meanings.sent1: Eating too much sugar can redispose you to cavities if you're not careful.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing sunscreen can redispose your skin to sunburn on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting your umbrella might redispose you to getting caught in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Being around sick people can redispose you to catching a cold.
meanings.sent5: Skipping meals can redispose your body to feeling weak and tired.
